intro: Quartinia repens, commonly known as the creeping quartinia, is a low-growing evergreen shrub native to the western United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, leathery leaves that are typically evergreen and can range in color from dark green to reddish-brown. It produces small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white or pink, often blooming in spring. Quartinia repens is well adapted to rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions.
